item.title: Why income share agreements did not work out
item.description:
Sean Linehan on Twitter

“I launched an Income Share Agreement (ISA) company in 2019. Our company survived, but our use of ISAs did not. Overall, I think the ISA experiment has failed and is not the revolution we hoped would transform training and education. Here’s what I learned 👇”

URL: https://twitter.com/seanlinehan/status/1505923007096700939

item.title: Why we have 0.05
item.description:
Daniël Lakens on Twitter

“I know I will not be able do much against viral incorrect tweets, but let’s try. No, we do not have 0.05 because of book sales. Fisher, 1926, did not pick any specific threshold. This paper https://t.co/is0IzNchht suggests SPSS (default of 0.05) did a lot to spread 0.05. https://t.co/zsoFmoLEz7”

URL: https://mobile.twitter.com/lakens/status/1503456387216687104?cxt=HHwWgIC-9crnrN0pAAAA

source: Wednesday assorted links

item.title: A hypothesis as to why Russia is focusing on Mariupol
item.description:
Thomas C. Theiner on Twitter

“I was asked for the reason that putin/russia is so hell-bent on conquering Mariupol. Let me explain. Thread: Originally putin assumed the invasion would be a cakewalk, allowing for a quick annexation of Donetsk and Luhansk (dark red). Other regions (light red) would then 1/8”

item.title: Goodbye Lenin
item.description:
Americans who watched or read Vladimir Putin’s address just prior to his invasion of Ukraine might have been puzzled by the many references to Lenin and the Bolsheviks as the “creators” of modern Ukraine and the detailed lecture on the mistakes of the Soviet Union’s nationalities policy. Surely, Putin, a former KGB man schooled in Marxism-Leninism, views the U.S.S.R. with nostalgia and his regional aggression is part of a project of putting back together the grandeur of that state? Well, yes but mostly no. For Russians like Putin, Lenin’s legacy is fraught. When there was talk about removing Lenin’s body from the mausoleum in Red Square in 2016, Putin…

URL: https://johnganz.substack.com/p/goodbye-lenin?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Continuing to Flog My Forthcoming Book: "Slouching Towards Utopia", September 6, Basic Books, &
